channel.content:encoded:
Lalalaletmeexplain is here to answer all YOUR questions around love, dating, sex, and relationships. Her unfiltered advice is not only candid and insightful, but she delivers you tough love when needed. Having swam the depths of the dating pool herself, Lala’s advice comes from a place of experience and expertise.

On Mondays Lala will be addressing a hot topic of the week, whether it’s a discussion around female misogyny blowing up your timeline or the arguments around Sex Education in schools that’s splashed across the headlines. Wednesdays she’s tackling your issues and conundrums around love, sex and relationships and on Fridays Lala will be diving into your dating dilemmas, red flag alerts, instant ick reactions and sharing her weekend reminders. And twice a month she’ll be joined by a guest to deliberate your questions.

Lala is the author of the best-selling dating guide Block, Delete, Move On, OK Mag’s resident agony aunt, a sexual health and relationship educator and she’s a social worker with over a decade of experience in child safeguarding and child protection. It's Not You, It's Them...But it Might Be You is the trustworthy, down to earth advice that you've been waiting for! 

A Sony Music Entertainment production.

Find more great podcasts from Sony Music Entertainment at sonymusic.com/podcasts and follow us at @sonypodcasts

To bring your brand to life in this podcast, email podcastadsales@sonymusic.com

To get in touch please DM Lala in instagram @asklalalaletmeexplain.

And if you would like to read more from Lala follow the link for her weekly OK Mag column. https://www.ok.co.uk/authors/Lalalaletmeexplain/

item.content:encoded:
Looking for love or navigating the modern dating world? We've got just the thing! How to Date is your ultimate guide to the highs, lows, and everything in between of modern romance. Hosted by broadcaster and author Elizabeth Day and relationship expert Mel Schilling, this podcast masterclass dives deep into the complexities of finding connection in today’s world.


Whether you're decoding dating apps, breaking old patterns, or building confidence, Elizabeth and Mel are here to help—with humour, honesty, and expert advice. Featuring candid conversations with fascinating guests, you'll learn how to spot red flags, avoid communication pitfalls, cope with rejection, and even find love that's truly worthy of you. Plus, practical tips and exercises make this a must-listen for anyone looking to date with confidence and self-worth.


After all, the most important relationship you’ll ever have is the one you have with yourself.


A Daylight and Sony Music Entertainment Production.


Find more great podcasts from Sony Music Entertainment at sonymusic.com/podcasts and follow @sonypodcasts To bring your brand to life in this podcast, email podcastadsales@sonymusic.com

item.content:encoded:
Voting registration closes tomorrow and your vote counts! If you're confused about who to vote for you're not alone but that doesn't mean you shouldn't vote. And what about dating someone who has different political views to you or doesn't think voting is important? Lala faced this in a past romantic relationship and took matters in to her own hands. Plus look out for the wokefish and brosialists. 


Register to vote here: www.gov.ukregister-to-vote 


If you'd like to ask Lala a question, get in touch @asklalalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together! 


A Sony Music Entertainment production

item.content:encoded:
Being made to feel disgusting because of pubic hair, worrying about cutting off contact with someone who is suicidal and your long term partner is texting another woman. Lala gives her two cents on your love and relationship dilemmas. 


If you'd like to ask Lala a question, get in touch @asklalalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together! 


If you're a victim of abuse you can find support at helpline@womensaid.org.uk 


If you or anyone you know is feeling suicidal you can seek help through the Samaritans by phoning 116 123

item.content:encoded:
Following on from the conversation with Ashley and Lauren from the Nip, Tuck, Not Giving A... podcast, Lala delves deeper into the problematic side to cosmetic surgery and the conflicting feelings it can bring up. She opens up about her own insecurities when it comes to looking good and her body image and asks should we be embracing this industry or rebelling against it?


If you'd like to ask Lala a question, get in touch @asklalalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together!

It's confessions Friday and you lot haven't been holding back... From identifying with Martha from Baby Reindeer to getting ghosted and putting their photos on Grindr, to sleeping with all your flatmates AND the landlord... item.title: Do Groomers Know They're Grooming?

item.content:encoded:
Sofie Hagen is a Danish comedian, podcaster, fat acceptance campaigner, and author of the new book, Will I Ever Have Sex Again?. In this conversation, Lala speaks with Sofie about the challenges many people face in having the sex they desire, the complexities of dating for fat people, and the importance of honesty in body image discussions. They also delve into Sofie's thoughts on the term "involuntarily celibate" and explore their theory on the four stages of saying no. 


If you'd like to ask Lala a question, get in touch @asklalalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together! 


A Sony Music Entertainment production

Father Lala is here to absolve you of all your recent confessions and sins. From wiping your nether regions with a sock, to rubbing chilli in your ex's yoga pants. Lala digs into your confessions. Plus your red flag questions are answered, such as, is it a red flag if he's a drug dealer? Or Is it a red flag that he's asked me not to speak to other men? Lala calls out your relationship red flags.

item.content:encoded:
After Danny Dyer's documentary 'Where Toxic Masculinity Comes From', Lala received masses of dm's from you wanting to know her opinion on it. So here it is. Lala breaks down the documentary, she discusses why it was important that it was made but also where it totally missed out on challenging problematic issues and opinions. Unlike Danny's conclusion that there is a war on men and that everyone sees masculinity as a bad thing, Lala observes that toxic masculinity is alive and kicking and a result of not understanding or addressing what it actually is to be a man. 


If you'd like to ask Lala a question, get in touch @asklalalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together!

item.title: Frightened of Forty

item.content:encoded:
Lala speaks to Africa Brooke the globally recognised consultant, mentor and speaker and who has a new book out 'The Third Persepctive'.  She went viral for her letter 'While I'm Leaving The Cult of Wokeness' where she rebuked the notion that because she is a black woman she is opressed. She encourages Lala to challenge some of her own beliefs and thoughts and feels without Africa's input on important topics such as trolling and cancel culture it would be a space less understood and debated. Their views might not always align, such as on feminism, but being able to have these types of conversations and to listen to each others experiences only makes our understanding richer and more dimensional. 


If you'd like to ask Lala a question get in touch @asklalalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together!

item.content:encoded:
Lala talks to actor and podcaster, Sarah Jayne Dunn. Sarah was controversially let go from her long running role as Mandy in Hollyoaks after revealing she had set up an Only Fans page. They discuss Sarah's experience of using an often misunderstood platform and how having such a public life from a young age affected her dating experiences. Plus, always arguing in the early stages of a relationship and not being introduced to your partners child, Lala and Sarah answer some of your dating dilemmas.


If you'd like to ask Lala a question, get in touch @asklalalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together!

item.content:encoded:
*TRIGGER WARNING - THIS EPISODE DISCUSSES THEMES OF ABUSE* 


In this Monday's hot topic Lala breaks down Netflix's hit show, Baby Reindeer. She looks at the backgorund of the main character 'Donny' (played by Richard Gadd in an autiobiographical role) and the abuse that he suffered prior to meeting his stalker, Martha. Lala looks at the behaviour 'Donny' displays as a victim of sexual abuse first and then of stalking, and at how common and understandable it is that victims keep going back to their abusers. 


If you'd like to ask Lala a question or a suggest a hot topic for her head to @asklalalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together! 


If you've been a victim of abuse you can find help at survivorsuk.org or rapecrisis.org.uk

For your hot topic this Monday Lala talks to Ashley and Lauren from the Nip, Tuck, Not Giving A... podcast. Both girls are from the cosmetic world having been former patient coordinators and both have had multiple procedures themselves. They discuss what and who we are having cosmetic surgery for. The judgement that surrounds beauty procedures as a whole and the best way to approach surgery if you are thinking of having it yourself.

item.title: Tell Him How Many Times You've Had An Orgasm!

item.content:encoded:
WARNING: This episode contains distressing content and imagary relating to the sexual abuse of children.


If you've watched 'Quiet On The Set' the documentary about the abuse suffered by children on Nickelodeon productions, I'm sure you'll be feeling sickened, outraged and appalled at what went on. But it's not just in Hollywood productions that this kind of abuse is occuring. Lala invites on an anonymous guest who decades after his sexual abuse found the strength to speak up.  Lala speaks about what grooming looks like, what signs parents can look out for as possible indications their child is being abused and asks that if anyone thinks they might have been victim of the same abuse as her guest, to please come forward. 

 

If you think you may have been or know of a victim of this abuse get in touch with @asklalaletmeexplain or @whitehotpanic on Instagram 

 

If you have been a victim of child abuse you can find help here help@NSPCC.org.uk

 

A Sony Music Entertainment production

item.description:
WARNING: This episode contains distressing content and imagary relating to the sexual abuse of children.



If you've watched 'Quiet On The Set' the documentary about the abuse suffered by children on Nickelodeon productions, I'm sure you'll be feeling sickened, outraged and appalled at what went on. But it's not just in Hollywood productions that this kind of abuse is occuring. Lala invites on an anonymous guest who decades after his sexual abuse found the strength to speak up.  Lala speaks about what grooming looks like, what signs parents can look out for as possible indications their child is being abused and asks that if anyone thinks they might have been victim of the same abuse as her guest, to please come forward. 

 

If you think you may have been or know of a victim of this abuse get in touch with @asklalaletmeexplain or @whitehotpanic on Instagram 

 

If you have been a victim of child abuse you can find help here help@NSPCC.org.uk

 

A Sony Music Entertainment production 



Find more great podcasts from Sony Music Entertainment at sonymusic.com/podcasts and follow us at @sonypodcasts 



To bring your brand to life in this podcast, email podcastadsales@sonymusic.com 



And if you would like to read more from Lala follow the link for her weekly OK Mag column https://www.ok.co.uk/authors/Lalalaletmeexplain/ 


Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.content:encoded:
Sending nudes. It's not as straightforward as it sounds. Just don't send them right? But it's more complicated than that for alot of us. They can appeal to a side that can make you feel good sure but what dangers are you exposing yourself to when you send them? And what about receiving unsolicited d**k pics?  There's almost always a darker side when it comes to nudes... 


If you'd like to ask Lala a question yourself, get in touch @asklalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together!

item.content:encoded:
In this episode, Lala delves into the intricacies of the justice system, drawing insights from a recent Channel 4 programme, "The Jury: Murder Trial." This experiment restaged a real-life murder trial before two separate juries of ordinary individuals, questioning if they would arrive at the same verdict.


Join Lala as she unpacks the implications of this unique experiment, exploring the nuances of jury decision-making and its potential impact on the justice system. From the lessons learned to the potential shifts in the future of the legal landscape, this episode provides a exploration of the intersection between the courtroom and public perception.


Credit: Channel 4. The Jury: Murder Trial. 


A Sony Music Entertainment production


Find more great podcasts from Sony Music Entertainment at sonymusic.com/podcasts and follow us at @sonypodcasts

item.content:encoded:
Why does stabbing someone on the street carry a lower minimum prison sentence than if you are stabbed in your home? Every week, 2 women are killed by their partner in the UK. In this powerful episode Lala tells the stories of women murdered by their partners and calls for action alongside the organisation Killed Women. It is a group set up by mothers of murdered daughters. They are advocating for improved sentencing and support systems.

 

Also, we hear from Julie Devey. Her daughter, Poppy, was stabbed to death by her former partner while asleep at home.

 

Killed Women https://www.killedwomen.org/

 

Audio from Murdered at Home ITV & ITVX 



If you'd like to ask Lala a question yourself, get in touch @asklalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together!


A Sony Music Entertainment production

item.content:encoded:
Please note: this episode contains descriptions of sexual abuse


Stephen Bear is a sex offender who has been released from prison after serving just 11 months of his 21 month sentence for image based sexual abuse, far less time than it took him to be convicted in the first place.


Lala discusses whether justice has really been served, has the law done it's job and what the future is for perpetrators like him, and his victim Georgia Harrison.


If you'd like to ask Lala a question, get in touch @asklalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together!


A Sony Music Entertainment production

And if you would like to read more from Lala follow the link for her weekly


OK Mag column https://www.ok.co.uk/authors/Lalalaletmeexplain/


Book recommendation from this episode:

Helena Kennedy - 'Misjustice: How British Law Is Failing Women'


Contacts from this episode:

Revenge Porn Helpline - 0345 6000 459/ www.revengepornhelpine.org.uk

I’m thrilled to announce that a brand-new season of the podcast How to Fail featuring the incredible Elizabeth Day is out now! The show is about celebrating resilience, growth and the wisdom that comes from our failures. Join Elizabeth as she sits down with incredible guests, each sharing three pivotal moment when life didn’t go as planned. From these stumbles, they uncover valuable lessons that propel them forward.


An Elizabeth Day and Sony Music Original Production.

It's ok though, Lala's always by our side to remind us, IT'S NOT US, and we're ok! Whether you're currently going through a break up, or never got over your ex, Lala has all the answers!

item.content:encoded:
Have you ever found yourself completely infatuated, to the point where it feels like a rollercoaster ride of emotions? Well, you're not alone. Lala unravels the often overlooked yet relatable topic of limerence - an obsessive infatuation that blurs the line between normal crushes and disturbing obsession.

Lala delves deep into its addictive nature, its impact on our daily lives, and why it's more common than you might think.

This episode has previously been released.

Got a question, for Lala? She’s all ears! Get in touch @asklalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together!

item.content:encoded:
It's Ick Friday for your listening pleasure. This week’s irrational reactions range from people trying to live out their best blockbuster movie life to someone bending over to reveal their "genital fruit bowl"!


Lala also tackles a range of potential red flags including monitoring online activities, first date gifts, and love-bombing. Plus Lala’s Friday night reminder encourages us to hold ourselves accountable and listen when someone has been clear with their intentions.


DM Lala on Instagram @asklalalaletmeexplain with your questions and dating dilemmas.

item.content:encoded:
Lala explores the disturbing dynamics of Bradley and Shona’s relationship from E4's popular television series Married at First Sight UK. She's looks at numerous example from the programme to help you understand signs of an unhealthy relationship and red flags, from narcissistic and controlling behaviour, to emotional manipulation.  


Plus Lala gets a first-hand account from Shona looking back at the turbulent relationship that has unfolded on our screens.


Got a question, for Lala? She’s all ears! Get in touch @asklalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together!

item.content:encoded:
Lala looks at the detrimental impact Andrew Tate is having on society. How his harmful views are influencing men, boys and even some woman and the far reaching consequences his misogynistic views have.


Plus Lala speaks about the BBC documentary Andrew Tate: The Man Who Groomed The World? exposing Tate's mysterious rise to prominence and uncovering the 'wizard' mastermind behind the cult-like organisations that Tate has been running.


Got a question, for Lala? She’s all ears! Get in touch @asklalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together!

item.content:encoded:
Lala is discussing age gaps within relationships, looking at how they manifest in both media portrayals and everyday life, and shedding light on the persistent gender-based double standards that often underpin these narratives. She explains what makes a healthy relationship and why it's crucial for the younger person in an age-gap relationship to have enough life experience, maturity, and readiness for major decisions like becoming a parent.


Got a question, for Lala? She’s all ears! Get in touch @asklalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together!


The National Domestic Abuse Helpline to discuss your options: call 0808 2000 247

item.content:encoded:
Have you heard the popular term 'love languages' used on TV programmes or across social media? They might not be the relationship magic bullet they're hyped up to be. In this episode, Lala breaks down the five love languages, unpicking parts of the book 'Five Love Languages: The Secret to Love That Lasts' and she's taking a look at the background behind this popular concept. This episode might just make you reconsider those popular love language quizzes and their underlying assumptions.


Got a question, for Lala? She’s all ears! Get in touch @asklalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together!

item.content:encoded:
Is it a red flag if someone asks you to record a video of consent before sex? How would you feel if the person you're dating still has nudes of their execs?


Lala is joined by campaigner, podcaster and TV personality Sharon Gaffka to answer your red flag questions and share some of her icks. Some of you may remember Sharon from the 2021 season of Love Island; but since then she's leveraged her fame to drive positive change, spearheading initiatives such as an anti-spiking campaign and raising awareness for breast cancer and cervical smear tests. She is also the ambassador for the charity Refuge and hosts the popular podcast Girls Know Nothing. 


Got a question, for Lala? She’s all ears! Get in touch @asklalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together!

item.content:encoded:
Lala delivers a special episode discussing the mainstream narrative around sexual assault and celebrity. She looks at the harmful reactions to rape allegations, particularly within online platforms, dissecting the disturbing trend of blaming victims and the culture that enables abusers, whilst also shedding light on the painful reality for those victims.


TRIGGER WARNING - This episode discusses rape and sexual abuse.


DM Lala on Instagram @asklalalaletmeexplain with your questions.

item.content:encoded:
Lala looks at the toxic culture and conversations around slut shaming women, in the wake of the recent internet feud between Logan Paul and Dillon Danis.


In the lead up to their boxing match Dillon Danis has been posting photos of Logan Paul’s fiancée, Nina Agdal with other men, in an attempt to shame and humiliate Logan Paul, whilst perpetuating the harmful narratives of women's sexuality. This isn't just about a celebrity boxing match; it's a glaring reflection of the double standards and damaging accounts about women's sexuality that persist today.


DM Lala on Instagram @asklalalaletmeexplain with your questions and dating dilemmas.


And to keep across the conversation head to @lalalaletmeexplain on Instagram.


A Somethin’ Else & Sony Music Entertainment production.


Find more great podcasts from Sony Music Entertainment at sonymusic.com/podcasts and follow us at @sonypodcasts

item.content:encoded:
La La recalls a hilarious and unnerving encounter from her twenties. Hear how a simple festival meetup and a seemingly innocent picnic date took a shocking turn, taking in drugs, sex and more than a little bit of blood. Enjoy this ‘eye’ opening tale that almost ended in an emergency visit to the hospital and a potential man(hood) slaughter charge!


If you’ve got any dating horror stories you’d like to share please get in touch @asklalaletmeexplain on Instagram.


Let's use our experiences to educate and protect each other as we navigate this journey together!

item.content:encoded:
Lala discusses the challenges of living with ADHD and the profound effects it has on relationships and everyday tasks. This episode explores ADHD's many layers, the addiction, compulsive behaviour, and even the inadequacies of our education system in accommodating people with ADHD.


Glossary of terms used in this episode


ADHD - Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) is a condition that affects people's behaviour. People with ADHD can seem restless, may have trouble concentrating and may act on impulse. https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/attention-deficit-hyperactivity-disorder-adhd/


PMDD - Premenstrual dysphoric disorder (PMDD) is a health problem that is similar to premenstrual syndrome (PMS) but is more serious. PMDD causes severe irritability, depression, or anxiety in the week or two before your period starts. Symptoms usually go away two to three days after your period starts. You may need medicine or other treatment to help with your symptoms. https://www.womenshealth.gov/menstrual-cycle/premenstrual-syndrome/premenstrual-dysphoric-disorder-pmdd#:~:text=Premenstrual%20dysphoric%20disorder%20(PMDD)%20is,days%20after%20your%20period%20starts.


DM Lala on Instagram @asklalalaletmeexplain with your questions and dating dilemmas. No topic is off limits or too embarrassing.


Lala is here to dive into those areas of life we’re questioning. And to keep across the conversation head to @lalalaletmeexplain on Instagram.

Got a question, an ick story or a red flag you need help with? We're all ears! Get in touch @asklalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together!

DM Lala on Instagram @asklalalaletmeexplain with your questions and dating dilemmas. No topic is off limits or too embarrassing.

Lala is speaking with Grace Campbell about the harsh truths surrounding rape, sexual assault, and the justice system. They look at the daunting task of reporting rape, the seemingly insurmountable challenges that survivors encounter in proving their cases in court and the stigma victims face after a verdict is not guilty.

item.content:encoded:
Have you ever found yourself completely infatuated, to the point where it feels like a rollercoaster ride of emotions? Well, you're not alone. Lala unravels the often overlooked yet relatable topic of limerence - an obsessive infatuation that blurs the line between normal crushes and disturbing obsession.


Lala delves deep into its addictive nature, its impact on our daily lives, and why it's more common than you might think.


DM Lala on Instagram @asklalalaletmeexplain with your questions and dating dilemmas. No topic is off limits or too embarrassing.


Lala is here to dive into those areas of life we’re questioning. And to keep across the conversation head to @lalalaletmeexplain on Instagram.

It’s time for the podcast premiere of f**kboy replies!! Lala’s f**kboy alter ego responds to text messages from someone sick of being the “other women”, a double ghosting and getting turned down to chill.


Hilarious ick stories are back and this week with hhhhonions, enjoying a cool breeze, and flexing muscles on Facetime.


And there is BIG news…We have an update from one of our listeners from our Negging Trolls, Needing Space and Mail Order Bride (July 26th) episode.


Plus don’t forget your Friday Night Reminders to make sure you start you weekend the correct way!


Got a question, an ick story or a f**kboy you need help with? We're all ears! Get in touch @asklalaletmeexplain on Instagram and let's navigate this romantic landscape together!

Have you fallen for a one night stand? When would you tell someone you’d like to date, that you have a 19 month child? Is it ok to text a colleagues’ work phone to ask him on a date? Lala is here every Wednesday to take on all your questions around sex, love, relationships and dating.


Listen to what Lala has to say in response to the questions above, from one night stands, approaching a colleague for a date and working out the best time to tell a man you’d like to date about your child.


DM Lala on Instagram @asklalalaletmeexplain with your questions and dating dilemmas. No topic is off limits or too embarrassing. Lala is here to shed light on those areas of life we’re questioning.


And to keep across the conversation head to @lalalaletmeexplain on Instagram.


A Sony Music Entertainment production.


Find more great podcasts from Sony Music Entertainment at sonymusic.com/podcasts and follow us at @sonypodcasts


To bring your brand to life in this podcast, email podcastadsales@sonymusic.com


And if you would like to read more from Lala follow the link for her weekly OK Mag column https://www.ok.co.uk/authors/Lalalaletmeexplain/

item.title: Negging Trolls, Needing Space and a Mail Order Bride?

item.content:encoded:
It’s hot take Monday where Lala discusses a topic that is currently being hotly debated. And this week Lala is discussing female misogynist grifters.

Have you seen the clips on social media or YouTube or heard these women on podcasts that are saying things like ‘I don’t think women should vote’ or ‘I am blessed to know feminism is a scam’. These are female misogynist grifters that live amongst the online manosphere.

They are women who actively promote or support misogyny and perpetuate harmful attitudes towards women. They’re in favour of traditional gender roles, they dismiss the idea of gender equality and criticise the feminist movements.

This Monday Lala is giving her opinion on the problematic views these women hold.

To keep across the conversation head to @lalalaletmeexplain on Instagram and if you would like to ask Lala a question DM her @asklalalaletmeexplain.


A Sony Music Entertainment production.

Find more great podcasts from Sony Music Entertainment at sonymusic.com/podcasts and follow us at @sonypodcasts

To bring your brand to life in this podcast, email podcastadsales@sonymusic.com


2:09 – Talk TV / Piers Morgan Uncensored. The 'Female Andrew Tate' Pearl Davis On Why She Thinks Women Shouldn't Vote. Source - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DHs7p6o5oBo

5:20 – Layah Heilpern YouTube Channel. Why I value traditional gender roles. Source - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sTWl3XprGhE&ab_channel=LayahHeilpern

11:53 –Masculinity Boost. Layah Heilpern speaking about her views on equality. Source - https://www.instagram.com/reel/Cm1wUWlrb6Y/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link&igshid=MzRlODBiNWFlZA%3D%3D masculinity.boost

12:24 - Talk TV / Piers Morgan Uncensored. Source - https://podcasts.apple.com/gb/podcast/piers-morgan-uncensored/id1618445014?i=1000619302231

item.content:encoded:
Lala brings her Instagram (@lalalaletmeexplain) to life with hilarious reactions to your ick stories and sharing her advice to your Red Flag alerts. Plus she’s dropping her Friday Reminder for you to have a f*ck person free weekend.

Ever felt an instant repulsion for a seemingly decent person and wondered why? Lala is diving down the rabbit hole of 'The Ick,' that strange sensation that's as hilarious as it is cruel and she’s replying to your funny ick stories.

Observing body language to decoding how someone talks about their exes, Lala is interpreting these warning signs in her feature, Is This A Red Flag? Learn how to distinguish between red flags, pink flags, and no flags.

Lala preps you for the weekend ahead with her Weekend Reminder. Before you invite that potential hook-up over, Lala drops some wise words to consider, ensuring no regrets later.

Got an Ick story or red flag query? We're all ears! Get in touch @asklalaletmeexplain and let's navigate this romantic landscape together!


A Sony Music Entertainment production.

Find more great podcasts from Sony Music Entertainment at sonymusic.com/podcasts and follow us at @sonypodcasts

To bring your brand to life in this podcast, email podcastadsales@sonymusic.com

And if you would like to read more from Lala follow the link for her weekly OK Mag column https://www.ok.co.uk/authors/Lalalaletmeexplain/

item.content:encoded:
Welcome to our first episode of It’s Not You, It’s Them…But It Might Be You.

Every Monday Lala brings you her hot take on a hot topic that is currently being hotly debated. And this week Lala is discussing the controversial conversation around sex education. In response to recent comments made by the MP Miriam Cates, Lala delves into the importance, purpose, and role sex education plays in shaping young minds.

As a social worker and sexual health educator Lala is a qualified voice amongst these arguments with an informed opinion. She addresses the concerns raised by the Tory MP and Daily Mail, whilst sharing facts and positive outcomes associated with comprehensive sex education.

Lala brings you an open and informed look that aims to empower us with information and challenge prevailing misconceptions.

To keep across the conversation head to @lalalaletmeexplain on Instagram and if you would like to ask Lala a question DM her @asklalalaletmeexplain.


A Sony Music Entertainment production.

Find more great podcasts from Sony Music Entertainment at sonymusic.com/podcasts and follow us at @sonypodcasts

To bring your brand to life in this podcast, email podcastadsales@sonymusic.com

Miriam Cates, Tory MP, House of Commons debate: Source https://www.miriamcates.org.uk/news/keeping-our-children-safe

item.content:encoded:
In her brand-new podcast, Lalalaletmeexplain is here to answer all YOUR questions around love, dating, sex, and relationships. Her unfiltered advice is not only candid and insightful, but she delivers you tough love when needed. Having swam the depths of the dating pool herself, Lala’s advice comes from a place of experience and expertise.

It's Not You, It's Them...But it Might Be You is the trustworthy, down to earth advice that you've been waiting for!

Listen every Monday, Wednesday and Friday wherever you get your podcasts.

item.title: Introducing: It's Not You, It's Them...But It Might Be You with LalalaLetMeExplain

channel.itunes:author: Sony Music Entertainment
channel.itunes:summary:
Lalalaletmeexplain is here to answer all YOUR questions around love, dating, sex, and relationships. Her unfiltered advice is not only candid and insightful, but she delivers you tough love when needed. Having swam the depths of the dating pool herself, Lala’s advice comes from a place of experience and expertise.

On Mondays Lala will be addressing a hot topic of the week, whether it’s a discussion around female misogyny blowing up your timeline or the arguments around Sex Education in schools that’s splashed across the headlines. Wednesdays she’s tackling your issues and conundrums around love, sex and relationships and on Fridays Lala will be diving into your dating dilemmas, red flag alerts, instant ick reactions and sharing her weekend reminders. And twice a month she’ll be joined by a guest to deliberate your questions.

Lala is the author of the best-selling dating guide Block, Delete, Move On, OK Mag’s resident agony aunt, a sexual health and relationship educator and she’s a social worker with over a decade of experience in child safeguarding and child protection. It's Not You, It's Them...But it Might Be You is the trustworthy, down to earth advice that you've been waiting for! 

A Sony Music Entertainment production.

Find more great podcasts from Sony Music Entertainment at sonymusic.com/podcasts and follow us at @sonypodcasts

To bring your brand to life in this podcast, email podcastadsales@sonymusic.com

To get in touch please DM Lala in instagram @asklalalaletmeexplain.

And if you would like to read more from Lala follow the link for her weekly OK Mag column. https://www.ok.co.uk/authors/Lalalaletmeexplain/
